She presented on ___ with abdominal pain and
inability to urinate. 

During work up for potential cord compression a pelvic mass was 
appreciated by OB-GYN during IUD removal for MRI evaluation. MRI 

revealed a T5 compressive lesion with severe canal narrowing and 

compression of the spinal cord. Further work up including CT 
torso showed multiple other lesions including lesions in the 
liver, lung, and redemonstration of the pelvic lesion. Patient 
underwent T5 vertebrectomy, T3-7 robotic posterior lami/fusion, 
bilateral T5 nerve root ligation & anterior column 
reconstruction without complication. Patient was subsequently 
transferred to ___ for further evaluation and treatment of 
suspected malignancy. Bone biopsy done at the time of spinal 
surgery revealed poorly differentiated metastatic 
adenocarcinoma. It was felt that this was from a GYN source, 
most suspicious for ovarian. She was treated with carboplatin 
___. Patient was found to have a PE on ___ and was treated 
with heparin gtt before being transitioned to apixaban.

Brief Hospital Course:
___ with PMH of ovarian cancer s/p chemo, metastatic to spine 
c/b T5 compression fracture s/p fusion and laminectomy ___, 
PE on Eliquis who presented to the ED withacute onset back pain, 
abdominal distention, and L leg swelling. In the ED, patient was 
noted to have elevated uric acid, hyperkalemia, lactic acidosis, 
and hyperphosphatemia c/f TLS. She was admitted to ___ given 
poor urine outpatient and lactic acidosis in setting of 
suspected TLS.

In the ICU, patient received aggressive fluid hydration and 
rasburicase with improvement of hyperuricemia. Her Hgb 
downtrended, though to be dilutional in setting of 4L IVF. She 
had persistent lactic acidosis and multisystem organ failure and 
as such, a family meeting was held with her primary oncologist. 
Patient was made CMO with a focus on comfort. Patient was 
started on a dilaudid gtt for pain with improvement of symptoms. 
Patient died on ___ at 11:45AM while receiving CMO with 
family at bedside.
